description: Identify survey areas, options including (1) Abobo and (2) Yopougon.
Indicates respondents gender, options including (1) female and (2) male.
"Level of education of respondents
column6: options including (1) no: the respondent did not go to school
column7: (2) primary: the respondent has an elementary level
column8: (3) coranic: the respondent went to a Quranic school
column9: (4) high school: the respondent has a high school degree
column10: and (5) graduate: the respondent has a university degree."

description: Description of the accommodation unit where the respondent lives, options including (1) common courtyard and (2) individual.

Indicates if respondent is the homeowner or not, options including (1) free host: the respondent is hosted for free, (2) owner: the respondent is the homeowner, and (3) renter: the respondent is the renter.
Does the surveyed household have latrine facilities?
Specifies the exact location of the latrine in the household, options including (1) house, (2) yard, and (3) out of yard.
Describes the type of latrine used in the household, options including (1) pit latrine, (2) improved latrine, and (3) public latrine.
Explains how latrines are used in the household
Reveals the number of users of the latrines.
Indication of how the respondent perceives the use of latrines, options including (1) hygiene problems, (2) no problems, (3) vulnerable to disease, and (4) waiting line.
Gives an overview of the people in charge of latrine cleaning, options including (1) myself, (2) no care, and (3) private person, and (4) round turn.
Specifies the cleaning frequency of latrines in the household.
Does the surveyed household have septic tank?
Specifies the exact location of the septic tank in the household, options including (1) court yard, (2) out of court yard, and (3) not know.
Reveals the number of latrines connecting to the septic tank.
Expresses septic tank performance status.
Indicates the number of times that the septic tank is emptied during the year in the household, options including (1) 1, (2) 2 and (3) 3.
Indicates how the septic tank is emptied in the household, options including (1) emptying truck, (2) manual emptying, and (3) truck and manual.
Shows the charge/price (in CFA franc) for emptying the septic tank.
Show whether the household has wastewater disposal facilities, options including (1) courtyard, (2) open drain, and (3) street.
Does the surveyed household have solid waste disposal facilities?
Precise location of solid waste disposal equipment, options including (1) courtyard and (2) out of courtyard.
Indicates the emptying frequency of solid waste disposal equipment per week
Overview of the most common disease in the household associated with sanitation, options including (1) diarrhea, (2) infections, (3) malaria, and (4) typhoid fever.
